interactions.description: Magnesium and calcium compete for absorption. Taking them together can reduce bioavailability of both.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2-3 hours apart. Take magnesium in evening, calcium in morning.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Both minerals use similar transport mechanisms in the gut, leading to competitive inhibition.

interactions.description: Calcium significantly reduces iron absorption when taken together.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart. Take iron on empty stomach, calcium with meals.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Calcium inhibits iron absorption by up to 50% when taken simultaneously.

interactions.description: Iron and zinc compete for absorption in the intestines.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart. Consider alternating days if high doses.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Both minerals use the DMT1 transporter, causing competitive inhibition.

interactions.description: High-dose zinc supplementation can cause copper deficiency over time.
interactions.recommendation: If taking >30mg zinc daily, add 2mg copper. Space zinc and copper by 2 hours.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Zinc induces metallothionein which binds copper, reducing absorption.

interactions.description: Calcium can reduce zinc absorption when taken together.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Calcium interferes with zinc absorption in the small intestine.

interactions.description: Magnesium is required for vitamin D activation. Taking together enhances benefits.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Magnesium supports vitamin D metabolism.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Magnesium is a cofactor for enzymes that activate vitamin D.

interactions.description: Vitamin D enhances calcium absorption. Taking together is beneficial.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Vitamin D improves calcium bioavailability.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Vitamin D increases calcium absorption in the intestines.

interactions.description: Vitamin C enhances iron absorption, especially non-heme iron.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Vitamin C improves iron bioavailability.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Vitamin C reduces ferric iron to ferrous form, improving absorption.

interactions.description: Magnesium and melatonin work together to promote relaxation and sleep.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Both support sleep quality.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Magnesium enhances melatonin's sleep-promoting effects.

interactions.description: Vitamin E protects omega-3 fatty acids from oxidation.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Vitamin E preserves omega-3 integrity.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Vitamin E acts as an antioxidant, preventing omega-3 oxidation.

interactions.description: Antibiotics can kill probiotics if taken simultaneously.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2-3 hours apart. Take probiotic 2-3 hours after antibiotic.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Antibiotics are designed to kill bacteria, including beneficial probiotics.

interactions.description: Zinc can reduce antibiotic absorption, particularly tetracyclines and quinolones.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart. Take antibiotic first, then zinc 2+ hours later.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Zinc chelates with certain antibiotics, reducing their bioavailability.

interactions.description: Calcium can reduce absorption of certain antibiotics (tetracyclines, quinolones).
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart. Take antibiotic first, then calcium 2+ hours later.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Calcium chelates with tetracycline and quinolone antibiotics.

interactions.description: Iron can reduce absorption of certain antibiotics (tetracyclines, quinolones).
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart. Take antibiotic first, then iron 2+ hours later.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Iron chelates with tetracycline and quinolone antibiotics.

interactions.description: High-fiber supplements can bind to and reduce absorption of other supplements.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 1-2 hours apart from other supplements.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Fiber can bind to minerals and other compounds, reducing bioavailability.

interactions.description: Caffeine (coffee, tea) can reduce iron absorption by up to 40%.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 1 hour apart. Avoid taking iron with coffee or tea.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Tannins in coffee and tea bind to iron, reducing absorption.

interactions.description: Calcium can significantly reduce absorption of thyroid medications (levothyroxine).
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 4 hours apart. Take thyroid medication on empty stomach, calcium later.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Calcium binds to levothyroxine, reducing absorption by up to 40%.

interactions.description: Iron can reduce absorption of thyroid medications (levothyroxine).
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 4 hours apart. Take thyroid medication on empty stomach, iron later.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Iron binds to levothyroxine, reducing absorption significantly.

interactions.description: B vitamins and vitamin C work together in energy metabolism.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. They complement each other in cellular processes.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Both are water-soluble and work together in metabolic pathways.

interactions.description: Magnesium is a cofactor for many B vitamin-dependent enzymes.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Magnesium supports B vitamin function.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Magnesium is required for activation of several B vitamin-dependent enzymes.

interactions.description: Zinc is required for vitamin A metabolism and transport.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Zinc supports vitamin A function.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Zinc is necessary for retinol-binding protein synthesis.

interactions.description: Zinc (in PepZin GI) can reduce iron absorption when taken together.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart. Take iron on empty stomach, PepZin GI with meals.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Zinc and iron compete for absorption via DMT1 transporter.

interactions.description: Zinc (in PepZin GI) and calcium can interfere with each other's absorption.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Calcium can reduce zinc absorption in the intestines.

interactions.description: DGL (Deglycyrrhizinated Licorice) works best in a neutral pH environment.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 30 minutes apart from acidic supplements or vitamin C.
interactions.scientific_evidence: DGL's protective effects are optimal at neutral pH.

interactions.description: L-Glutamine is an amino acid that works well with protein intake.
interactions.recommendation: Can be taken together. Both support muscle and gut health.
interactions.scientific_evidence: L-Glutamine is a conditionally essential amino acid.

interactions.description: Aloe vera may interact with certain medications. Consult healthcare provider.
interactions.recommendation: Space at least 2 hours apart from medications. Consult doctor if on prescription meds.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Aloe vera can affect drug metabolism and absorption.

interactions.description: Melatonin may increase bleeding risk when combined with blood thinners.
interactions.recommendation: Consult healthcare provider before combining. Monitor for increased bleeding.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Melatonin may have anticoagulant effects.

interactions.description: High-dose omega-3 may increase bleeding risk when combined with blood thinners.
interactions.recommendation: Consult healthcare provider. Monitor for increased bleeding. Consider lower dose.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Omega-3 fatty acids have mild anticoagulant effects.

interactions.description: St. John's Wort can interact with many medications by affecting liver enzymes.
interactions.recommendation: Consult healthcare provider. Can reduce effectiveness of many prescription drugs.
interactions.scientific_evidence: St. John's Wort induces CYP450 enzymes, affecting drug metabolism.

interactions.description: Grapefruit can interact with many medications by inhibiting liver enzymes.
interactions.recommendation: Avoid grapefruit with medications. Consult healthcare provider.
interactions.scientific_evidence: Grapefruit inhibits CYP3A4, affecting drug metabolism.
